ticket.title: Rails 2.1.2 from_json broken?
ticket.original-body:
I can't call the from_json method on any ActiveRecord object, no matter what the passed string is. I tested this on windows and on linux with Rails 2.1.2 and it failed, so I think it's probably broken.. Please provide a workaround.
$ script/generate model Blah title:string description:text $ rake db:migrate >> blah = Blah.new => #<Blah id: nil, title: nil, description: nil, created_at: nil, updated_at: nil> >> blah.from_json('asdf') NoMethodError: undefined method `stringify_keys!' for "asdf":String from /var/lib/gems/1.8/gems/activerecord-2.1.2/lib/active_record/base.rb:2366:in `attributes=' from /var/lib/gems/1.8/gems/activerecord-2.1.2/lib/active_record/serializers/json_serializer.rb:64:in `from_json' from (irb):3

version.title: Rails 2.1.2 from_json broken?

version.body:
You have to pass a json string that corresponds to a hash - what would blah.from_json('asdf') even mean?
@@@ ruby Blah.new.from_json("{title: 'hello world'}") @@@
works fine for me.
version.body-html:
You have to pass a json string that corresponds to a hash - what would blah.from_json('asdf') even mean?


Blah.new.from_json("{title: 'hello world'}")

works fine for me.

version.title: Rails 2.1.2 from_json broken?

version.body: That's probably a detail of the JSON parser in rails - if you just give it a string it returns that string whereas if you pass a string in the correct form it returns a hash (which of course causes problem with the code that assumes it has a hash)
